VariableDescription.Name: Pixel
VariableDescription.LongDescription: Auroral luminosity, 557.7nm keogram, all-sky camera at Kilpisjarvi (N69.02,E20.79)
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     TITLE                           FMI/ASC KILPISJARVI N69.02 E20.79
#     FILTER                          557nm
#     MODS                            CDF created 31.05.1999 11:32:29 UTC.
#     SOURCE                          FMI>Finnish Meteorological Institute.
#     CONTACT                         Kirsti.Kauristie@fmi.fi
#     DESCRIPTOR                      KILP>Kilpisjarvi All-Sky Camera
#     TEXT                            Keograms are quick-look data of an all-sky camera at
#                                     Kilpisjarvi (69.02 N, 20.79 E)
#                                     maintained and operated by the Finnish Meteorological Institute.
#                                     Keograms show the intensity along the middle meridian of the camera
#                                     field-of-view as a function of time. The camera has a fish-eye lens
#                                     of 180 degrees and narrow bandpass interference filters of wavelengths
#                                     557.7 nm (green) and 630.0 nm (red). In standard operating mode, the sampling                          
#                                      interval                                                                                              
#                                     is 20 s and 60 s for the red and green images, respectively.
#                                     The exposure time is typically 1000 ms. The time resolution of keograms
#                                     is 1 min and they are constructed using only the green images.
#                                     The size of a digital image is 512x512 pixels and intensity values
#                                     vary between 0 and 255. At the altitude of 110 km the field-of-view
#                                     (with reasonable spatial resolution) is a spherical area with the
#                                     diameter of 600 km.  The keograms shown here are intensity versus latitude
#                                     plots while the original keograms (available in http://www.geo.fmi.fi/MIRACLE
#                                     are intensity versus zenith angle plots.
#                                     The conversion from zenith angle dependence to equidistant latitude grid
#                                     causes occasionally artificial two-band structure to the keograms
#                                     (light bands below and above the darker zenith).
#                                     The artefact becomes visible especially during quiet periods,
#                                     and the autoscaling color palette may even strengthen the effect.
#                                     Note that some keograms show also the Moon as a sphere or ellipsoid with
#                                     very high, even saturating intensities.
#     DATA_TYPE                       K0>Key Parameter
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Ionospheric Science
#     SOURCE_NAME                     FMI>Finnish Meteorological Institute
#     PROJECT                         ISTP
#     PI_NAME                         K. Kauristie
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  Finnish Meteorological Institute
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     GENERATION_DATE                 CDF created 31.05.1999 11:32:29 UTC
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     RULES_OF_USE                    http://www.geo.fmi.fi/~syrjasuo/asc_rules_of_the_road.html
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Ground-Based Imagers
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Ground-Based Investigations
#                                     !___ITM Data including Earth Imaging and Ground-Based
#     GENERATED_BY                    Finnish Meteorological Institute
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1 Minute
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  fm_k0_kilp
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 fm_k0_kilp_19990102_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      FMI Kilpisjarvi: All-Sky Camera Key Parameters
#     LINK_TEXT                       Please consult
#                                     For additional information about this data, also see
#     LINK_TITLE                      key notes on the correct interpretation of keograms.
#                                     the FMI all-sky camera home pages.
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://rumba.gsfc.nasa.gov/cdaweb/misc/NotesF.html#FM_K0_KILP
#                                     http://www.geo.fmi.fi/MIRACLE/ASC/index.html
#     ALT_LOGICAL_SOURCE              Finnish-Meteorlogical -Inst_Kilpisjarvi_Key-Parameters-K0_1min_cdf
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Time of observation
#  2. Auroral luminosity, 557.7nm keogram, all-sky camera at Kilpisjarvi (N69.02,E20.79)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 17:40:13 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#
EPOCH                       AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY     AURORAL_LUMINOSITY
